Dear Ms. Patterson:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed
on 08/05/2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes and rules are also violations of
the Modified Implementation Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements and
your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Courtney Atkins, Area Manager at (517) 599-3667.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
R 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan.
Rule 400.4155 (1) The social service worker shall complete, sign,
and date an initial treatment plan for each resident within 30
calendar days of admission.
One of 3 current resident files reviewed did not have a initial service plan completed
within the required 30 calendar days. The resident was admitted on 08/27/2019 and
the initial service plan was dated 10/02/2019.
R 400.4156
Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
Rule 400.4156. (1) The social service worker shall complete, sign,
and date an updated treatment plan for each resident at least once
every 90-calendar days following the initial treatment plan.
One of 3 current resident files reviewed did not have a updated service plan
completed within the required 90 days. The resident’s service plan had a report
period begin date of 12/24/2019 and an end date of 03/22/2020. The report creation
date was 03/26/2020 which is beyond the required 90 calendar day time frame.
3

R 400.4166 Discharge plan.
Rule 400.4166 (1) When a resident is discharged from
institutional care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after discharge:
(a) The date of and reason for discharge, and the new
location of the child.
(b) A brief summary or other documentation of the services
provided while in residence, including medical and dental
services.
(c) An assessment of the resident’s needs that remain to be
met.
(d) Any services that will be provided by the facility after
discharge.
(e) A statement that the discharge plan recommendations,
including medical and dental follow up that is needed, have
been reviewed with the resident and with the parent and with
the responsible case manager.
(f) The name and official title of the person to whom the
resident was discharged.
One of 4 discharged resident files reviewed did not have a discharged service plan.

EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one incident of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
Special Investigation 2019C0102002 and a joint DHHS investigation found an
inappropriate relationship between a female staff and a male resident. A corrective
action plan was approved on 05/08/2019. A second CAP requested and received on
07/27/2020 reviewing three incidents. The reports were 2019C0102002 and
2019C0102015. These special investigations involved adult staff being sexual toward
residents. The second CAP outlined training on boundaries, supervising employees
closer, and training on Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA). Also, a dedicated trainer
to observe resident-staff inaction.
The facility has submitted eight acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
During the licensing period there were seven additional special investigations
which required corrective action plans:
 2018C0102026 cited rule CCI145 for not providing a needed medical exam after
a restraint injury. The CAP requires that all residents that are restrained will be
examined by the on-site nurse.
 2019C0102015 cited rule CCI112(1) involved a male staff sending an
inappropriate picture to a discharged resident. A second CAP was requested and
received on 07/27/2020.
 2019C010218 cited CCI142(1) when residents were “cheeking” medications and
sharing them with other residents. The CAP focused on improving training and
procedures regarding the dispensing of medications.
 2019C0102025 cited CCI127(4) and rule CCI148 which involved 15-minute room
checks and attending to residents’ personal hygiene. The CAP outlined training
and discipline to adhere to these rules.
 2019C0102030 cited rule CCI163(2)(a) for having a resident in seclusion beyond
72 hours. The CAP was to review this rule at weekly team meeting and have all
staff sign off on the meeting minutes.
 2019C0214043 cited the facility for CCI142 Health Services, JR3 302 Behavior
Health Delivery, and CCI165(1) Lockdown. The CAP addressed Health Services
by changing procedures and creating new forms. The CAP for Behavioral Health
involved hiring a second Social Worker. The CAP regarding Lockdown will
increase the number of “float” positions and change the work hours of the group
leaders.
 2020C0102002 cited rule CCI159(1) following policy to report restraints in
MiSACWIS (Michigan Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System).
5

The CAP provided that all supervisors will be responsible to enter restraints into
MiSACWIS.
The interim inspection completed on 09/25/2019 cited the following: Rule CCI113(g)
where the facility is required to do an evaluation of any Staff member’s criminal
convictions. The CAP was to complete the required document and monitor for future
need of evaluations. There was no repeat violation regarding rule CCI113(g). The
CAP for Rule CCI114 tuberculosis screening changed the procedure to do TB on-
site and there were no repeat violations. CCI116(1) Discharge Summary was cited in
this report and is a repeat violation. The CAP involved sending email reminders to
complete the discharge summary. This CAP was not successful and new policy,
procedures and training will need to be developed.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
